title: Purple draconian
data:

*For a list of all draconians, see [list of draconians](/List_of_draconians "List of draconians").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A muscular purple-scaled humanoid with a reptilian tail and small wings.***“Trogdor was a man! I mean, he was a dragon-man! Or... maybe he was just a dragon. ... And the Trogdor comes in the night!” -The Brothers Chaps, “Trogdor”. 2003. |

## Useful Info

**Purple draconians** are the [magic](/Magic "Magic")-themed members of the [draconian](/List_of_draconians "List of draconians") family. They have the same irresistible breath attacks as [quicksilver dragons](/Quicksilver_dragon "Quicksilver dragon"), dealing moderate damage (3d20) and greatly reducing the duration of any magical buffs you may have in place. Fortunately, they have only normal speed, and thus can't hit you with this nearly as often.

While they lack any sort of elemental resistance, they have much higher [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") than any other draconians. They can be found primarily in [the Realm of Zot](/The_Realm_of_Zot "The Realm of Zot").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                 |                                                                                                           |
| :---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Quicksilver Bolt](/Quicksilver_Bolt "Quicksilver Bolt") (3d20) | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Breath flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Their energy breath cannot be resisted, only dodged or blocked with a [shield](/Shield "Shield"), which makes them fairly dangerous. You probably won't want to bother with any buffs until you've cleared them out.
- [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing")-[branded](/Brand "Brand") weapons and [curare](/Curare "Curare")-tipped [darts](/Dart "Dart") help make combat against them much easier.
html:
Purple draconian

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.26: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all draconians, see list of draconians.

purple draconian d 
HP 64-131
HD 14
XP 1234
Speed 10
AC 8
EV 10
Will 140
Attack1 20 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type draconian, purple draconian
Flags Cold-blooded
Speaks
A muscular purple-scaled humanoid with a reptilian tail and small wings.

“Trogdor was a man!
I mean, he was a dragon-man!
Or... maybe he was just a dragon.
...
And the Trogdor comes in the night!”
-The Brothers Chaps, “Trogdor”. 2003.

Useful Info

Purple draconians are the magic-themed members of the draconian family. They have the same irresistible breath attacks as quicksilver dragons, dealing moderate damage (3d20) and greatly reducing the duration of any magical buffs you may have in place. Fortunately, they have only normal speed, and thus can't hit you with this nearly as often.

While they lack any sort of elemental resistance, they have much higher willpower than any other draconians. They can be found primarily in the Realm of Zot.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Quicksilver Bolt (3d20) Natural flag,
Breath flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Their energy breath cannot be resisted, only dodged or blocked with a shield, which makes them fairly dangerous. You probably won't want to bother with any buffs until you've cleared them out.
  • Freezing-branded weapons and curare-tipped darts help make combat against them much easier.
